p: The fluorimetric method for the determination of 1-3-β- d-glucan content using aniline blue was used for the first time for the determination of the content of these compounds in food samples by Ko et al. [ 52]. For the first time, Nitschke et al. used the fluorimetric method for the determination of 1,3-β-glucans of a non-branched structure in mushrooms [ 29] as well as Gil Ramirez et al. [ 50]. Some studies declare that such fluorimetric method is specific to (1→3)-β- d-glucan binding, but it showed certain limitations that were not always appraised, i.e., the polymerization degree, presence/absence of substituents and their chemical conformation might modulate the fluorimetric determination [ 8, 50, 58].
